summary: This is an email chain from May 2020 between FBI agents and US Attorney's Office (NY) personnel discussing the status of the Epstein investigation and the potential charging of Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes operational updates on Maxwell's suspected location and proposed investigative steps.

persons.name: Ponder, J.
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, FBI New York
persons.context: FBI agent who sent the initial email summarizing the status of the Epstein investigation regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and introducing a new ASAC.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Discussed as the target of a potential charging decision by SDNY for her complicity in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the central figure whose sex trafficking activities Maxwell is accused of facilitating.

connections.description: Maxwell is under investigation for her complicity in Epstein's sex trafficking operation.
Ponder is an FBI agent providing an update on the investigation and proposed surveillance tactics targeting Maxwell.

events.title: Investigation status update call
events.description: A call was held between the FBI and US Attorney's Office to discuss the Epstein investigation and the charging decision for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: FBI assessment of Maxwell's location
events.description: As of January 2020, the FBI believed Ghislaine Maxwell was living with a friend in Manchester by the Sea, a Boston suburb.

keyFacts: SDNY was close to a final decision on charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in Epstein's sex trafficking as of May 2020.
The FBI believed Maxwell was living with a friend in Manchester by the Sea, MA, confirmed via historical pen register, cell site location, and Amazon delivery subpoenas.
Due to the secluded location, traditional surveillance was deemed unsuitable; proposed next steps included a renewed pen register, Amazon subpoenas, and possibly a mail cover.
The email chain coordinates the transition of an FBI ASAC (Assistant Special Agent in Charge) for the NYO's Violent Crime/Gang Branch who will work on the case.
